_data.text:
We are [def:studio](https://github.com/def-studio), a web and software agency located in Bari, Apulia, south of Italy.

This package was made and is actively maintained by [Daniele Romeo](mailto:danieleromeo@defstudio.it) and [Fabio Ivona](fabio.ivona@defstudio.it), along with of our staff and [many other contributors](https://github.com/def-studio/pest-plugin-laravel-expectations/graphs/contributors).

_data.description: Telegraph is a Laravel package that enables easy Telegram Bots interaction

Get the full source code at

_data.text: #### Telegraph is a Laravel package that enables easy Telegram Bots interaction ```php Telegraph::message('this is great')->send(); ``` Get the full source code at [https://github.com/def-studio/telegraph](https://github.com/def-studio/telegraph) This plugin is powered by [def:studio](https://github.com/def-studio)

_data.title: Installation & Configuration

children.value: You can install the package via composer:
In order to work, Telegraph needs you to run its migrations:
You can publish the config file with:
here's an example of what you'll find:

/*
     * Sets Telegraph messages default parse mode
     * allowed values: html|markdown
     */

/*
     * Sets the handler to be used when Telegraph
     * receives a new webhook call.
     *
     * For reference, see https://def-studio.github.io/telegraph/webhooks/overview
     */

/*
     * If enabled, Telegraph dumps received
     * webhook messages to logs
     */

_data.text:
You can install the package via composer:

``` bash
composer require defstudio/telegraph
```

### Set up

In order to work, Telegraph needs you to run its migrations:

```bash
$> php artisan vendor:publish --tag="telegraph-migrations"

$> php artisan migrate
```

### Configuration

You can publish the config file with:

```bash
$> php artisan vendor:publish --tag="telegraph-config"
```

here's an example of what you'll find:

```php
return [
    /*
     * Sets Telegraph messages default parse mode
     * allowed values: html|markdown
     */
    'default_parse_mode' => Telegraph::PARSE_HTML,

    /*
     * Sets the handler to be used when Telegraph
     * receives a new webhook call.
     *
     * For reference, see https://def-studio.github.io/telegraph/webhooks/overview
     */
    'webhook_handler' => EmptyWebhookHandler::class,

    /*
     * If enabled, Telegraph dumps received
     * webhook messages to logs
     */
    'debug_mode' => false,

    /*
     * Message queue configuration
     */
    'queue' => [
        /*
         * Enables sending requests towards Telegram apis through Laravel's queue system
         */
        'enable' => true,

        /*
         * Sets the default queue to be used
         */
        'on_queue' => 'default',
    ],
];
```

_data.text:
Have you any issue our package? Any bug comes up? Do you have any question or want to suggest an improvement? feel free to [create a new issue](https://github.com/def-studio/telegraph/issues) and we will take the best efforts to help you


If you have found any issue regarding security, please email [report@defstudio.it](mailto:report@defstudio.it) instead of using the issue tracker.

_data.text: - Go to [@BotFather](https://t.me/botfather) on Telegram. - Send `/newbot`, to start creating a new Bot and setting its name and username. - take note of the bot **token**. - Now you need to allow your Bot to send direct messages, so send `/setjoingroups` to @BotFather, select your Bot and click Enable: - (optional) To let your bot to listen for commands (like `/chatid`) you need to enable privacy mode: send `/

If you are implementing a custom bot creation logic, you can create a new bot using the

_data.text: Any number of bots can be created, both programmatically and through an artisan command ### through artisan command You can add a new bot issuing the dedicated _artisan_ command: ```shell php artisan telegraph:new-bot ``` you will be guided through a bot creation wizard that will (optionally) allow you to add a new chat and setup a bot webhook as well ### programmatically If you are implementing a custom bot creation logic, you can create a new bot using the `TelegraphBot` model: ```php $bot = TelegraphBot::create([ 'token' => $token, 'name' => $name, ]); ```

_data.title: Adding a chat to a Telegraph Bot

children.value: Associating a chat to a bot, lets you send messages to that chat and interacting with commands
command inside the chat after having
the bot_id argument is mandatory if you have created more than one bot
If you are implementing a custom bot creation logic, you can create a new chat using the

_data.text:
Associating a chat to a bot, lets you send messages to that chat and interacting with commands

<alert type="info">**Note:** to get the _chat_id_ issue the `/chat_id` command inside the chat after having [set up a webhook](quickstart/setting-webhook).</alert>


### through an artisan command

```shell
php artisan telegraph:new-chat {bot_id}
```

the bot_id argument is mandatory if you have created more than one bot

### programmatically

If you are implementing a custom bot creation logic, you can create a new chat using the `TelegraphChat` model:

```php
/** @var TelegraphChat $chat */
$chat = $telegraph_bot->chats()->create([
    'chat_id' => $chat_id,
    'name' => $chat_name,
]);
```

_data.title: Setting a webhook for the bot

children.value: A webhook lets your bot to answer commands issued from telegram chats and buttons inside messages
argument is mandatory if you have created more than one bot

_data.text:
A webhook lets your bot to answer commands issued from telegram chats and buttons inside messages

### through an artisan command

```shell
php artisan telegraph:set-webhook {bot_id}
```

the `bot_id` argument is mandatory if you have created more than one bot

### programmatically

```php
/** @var TelegraphBot $bot */
$bot->registerWebhook()->send();
```

_data.title: Webhooks Overview

children.value: Telegram bots can interact with chats and users through a webhook system that allow to be updated about chats changes, new commands and user interactions without continuously polling Telegram for updates.

_data.text:
Telegram bots can interact with chats and users through a webhook system that allow to be updated about chats changes, new commands and user interactions without continuously polling Telegram for updates.
